page.title: 01BURWELL,REACH,SWAFFHAM 1985.
page.content: Our block is on the Cambs/West Suffolk border.Cambridge and Ely are 12 miles away and Newmarket 4. It has{three main settlements,} Burwell, Swaffham Prior and Reach.They are{dormitory villages}for Cambridge.} All are placed on higher chalk ground {along a spring line above The Fens. The{population}of Swaffham Prior is over 2000;Burwell is over 4500 and Reach is over 200. {Agriculture}in Burwell is mostly {arable.}Otherwise the main source of work is at St Regis Corrugated{Card- {board Factory. Burwell is named because of remains at Spring Close.{(Bur}means{fort}and {well}means means{spring).} In southern Burwell are 2 first {schools,}Ness Road and Parsonage Lane. Between the villages lies an ancient earthwork,{The Devil's Ditch.}
